item.itunes:title: Floods, Famine and Pestilence: The Impact of Crisis on the Mobile Home Park Industry
item.title: Floods, Famine and Pestilence: The Impact of Crisis on the Mobile Home Park Industry
item.description:
Our recent event is on a topic that should interest almost everyone at the moment: the impact of disasters (natural and economic) on mobile home park investing. Sure, Covid-19 is the current disaster in America, but it’s not the only one we’ve endured over the last three decades (The Texas S&L Crisis, the Dot.com bust, earthquakes, fires, tornadoes, Katrina, Harvey, and the Great Recession). So if catastrophes are a part of American life, what is the impact on the mobile home park industry and how will these events impact your investment?

Your host is Frank Rolfe who, with his partner Dave Reynolds, is the 5th largest owner of mobile home parks in the U.S. But more importantly, he has lived through every crisis in modern American history, and seen 16% interest rates, every office building in Dallas posted for foreclosure, floodwaters, fires, the mobile home “chattel crisis” of 1999 – and everything else you can name. And he has seen first-hand the impact on mobile home parks from these issues.

item.itunes:title: Thoughts On Proper Park Management With Shannon Smith
item.title: Thoughts On Proper Park Management With Shannon Smith
item.description:
Shannon Smith is our Regional Vice-President for five states: 1) North Dakota 2) South Dakota 3) Minnesota 4) Wisconsin and 5) the Upper Peninsula of Michigan. She’s been in the industry for nearly a decade, having served with YES communities before our company. And she’s one of the best in the business. 

In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report we’re going to discuss with Shannon the essential parts of community management focusing on collections, rules compliance, property condition, sales and marketing and budgeting. We’re also going to explore some of the considerations with properties that are subject to severe winter temperatures as low as 40 degrees below zero for weeks at a time.

item.itunes:title: A Detailed Discussion Of The Impact Of Covid-19 On The MH Industry
item.title: A Detailed Discussion Of The Impact Of Covid-19 On The MH Industry
item.description: The Covid-19 crisis is unparalleled in American history – we’ve never shut the nation down before to try to stop the spread of a virus. As a result, a huge number of businesses have been wiped out or weakened, and most Americans are having to stay home from work and endure self-quarantine. But the big question is “what will this do to the MH industry in the near term as well as long-term?” That’s what we’re going to focus on in this edition of the MHU Investor’s Club Special Report. We’re going to review the overall impact based on geography and tenant employment, and the impact on collections, home renovations, occupancy, rent control and similar laws, buying parks, financing parks, and the future implications for the industry. Together, we can get through this unique disruption.

item.itunes:title: Pitches & Hits With Eric Wanck - March 2020
item.title: Pitches & Hits With Eric Wanck - March 2020
item.description: Eric Wanck has been a mobile home park broker for nearly a decade, and is with The MHP Brokers agency. In this edition of Pitches and Hits, he’s going to review three listings he has in Alabama in Georgia. All three listings are priced based on lot rent only, and are in markets that meet most of the Boot Camp guidelines of around 100,000 metro population, $100,000 single-family home cost, $1,000 3-bedroom apartment rent and a diversified economy based on a large amount of education, healthcare and government employment. As always, Frank will be there to provide color commentary on the markets.

item.itunes:title: An Interview With Tom Rusing from CAVCO Homes
item.title: An Interview With Tom Rusing from CAVCO Homes
item.description: CAVCO homes really wants your business. And they are doing everything possible to make that happen, including hiring a dedicated salesperson just for MHU and our portfolio. That’s right, going forward if you are a member of the MHU community and want to order a home from CAVCO you simply call your personal agent, Tom Rusing, at (574) 596-8719. He can get you the home you need and have it delivered anywhere in the U.S. And this unique opportunity is the theme of this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report in which Tom is going to talk about what CAVCO has to offer and how he can deliver a home to you within 4 to 6 weeks (about half the time of most other manufacturers). He’s also going to review CAVCO’s “Revive” financing program (similar to CASH but has only a 5-home minimum vs. 21st Mortgage’s 10-home), the huge variety of brands and product lines CAVCO has to offer, and even a rundown of how easy it is to buy a home from CAVCO.

item.itunes:title: Bank Chat with MJ Vukovich - The Truth Vs. The Myths On Conduit And Agency Debt - March 2019
item.title: Bank Chat with MJ Vukovich - The Truth Vs. The Myths On Conduit And Agency Debt - March 2019
item.description: MJ Vukovich of Bellwether is one of the top loan brokers in the U.S. – and Bellwether is an originator of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac “agency” debt. In this edition of Bank Chat we’re going to discuss the topic “The Truth vs. The Myths on Conduit and Agency Debt” with MJ, and try to unlock the fact vs. fiction in this extremely attractive form of debt. With Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac now representing over 50% of all new mobile home park debt (based on dollar volume) it’s extremely important that all mobile home park buyers and owners understand this option and how it really works.

item.itunes:title: "Harnessing New Housing Types" With Gary Lester
item.title: "Harnessing New Housing Types" With Gary Lester
item.description: Gary Lester is a MHU Investor’s Club member in Moscow, Idaho who bought a park with significant vacancy and saw an opportunity to bring in alternative housing types such as RVs, park models and “tiny homes”. But the ordinances did not allow these housing types on a long-term basis. So he took on the many hurdles of zoning and city hall and, in the end, won. In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report we’re going to discuss his story and how he was able to convince a city that his property could solve the affordable housing crisis using housing types in addition to mobile homes. If you have even one vacant lot that might appeal to alternative housing demand, then this discussion should be of interest.

item.itunes:title: Deal Bought and Dropped - February 2020
item.title: Deal Bought and Dropped - February 2020
item.description: A small park in a metro of 4,500 and a large park in a metro of 7,100,000. One was a winner and one a loser. But which one? In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report we’re going to review “A Deal We Bought and a Deal We Dropped” and look at the granular details that made us close on one property and throw the other back. If you think that appearances can be deceiving then you are 100% correct on these two properties. We think that reviewing past deals is a great way to look for the key drivers to making the decision to go forward or not, and these two deals both have surprise endings.

item.itunes:title: Doomsday Debt Preppers On Bank Chat With John Medernach - February 2020
item.title: Doomsday Debt Preppers On Bank Chat With John Medernach - February 2020
item.description: “Stagflation”, “Texas S&L Crash”, “Dot.Com Bust”, “Great Recession” – we have no shortage of national recessions/depressions in the U.S. So how do you prepare for these potential shock waves? In this installment of our Bank Chat se­­­ries, we’re going to talk with John Medernach, a long-time MHU Investor’s Club member and Executive Vice-President of First Secure Community Bank in Aurora, Illinois. The discussion will include what causes a loan to go into default, how to mitigate this, how to approach your banker, how to come to an amiable agreement with the lender, and what to do if no amiable plan can be forged. With a potential U.S. recession believed to be in store in 2021 (according to many economists) it’s never too early to be “prepping” for the next great downturn.

item.itunes:title: Lessons Learned With Ryan Wanner
item.title: Lessons Learned With Ryan Wanner
item.description: Ryan Wanner is an MHU Investor’s Club member who has grown to five parks owned and one pending in only three years. Along the way he has learned a huge number of truths about mobile home park investing. In this edition of “Lessons Learned”, Ryan is going to discuss his top strategies for success that he’s learned through experimentation and hard work. We’re firm believers that the best source of information on the mobile home park business is from those who already know the reality from the theory through owning and operating properties – which is what “Lessons Learned” is all about.

item.description: Lending is a huge part of the mobile home park industry and, with that in mind, we’ve chosen the first MHU Investor’s Club Special Report of 2020 to be our Bank Chat show. Our guest is M.J. Vukovich of Bellwether, one of the top loan brokers in the U.S. (and an originator on Fannie Mae/Freddie Mac debt). item.title: Pitches & Hits With Joanne Stevens - December 2019
item.description: Sure, it’s Christmas time, but parks are still going on the market throughout the holiday season. In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report, Joanne Stevens is going to review a three-park package that is about to go on the market in Iowa, as well as two parks in Michigan that have recently had their prices reduced (and the market’s not bad with over 100,000 population, nearly $100,000 home price and almost $1,000 per month 3-bedroom apartment rent). As always, Joanne is among the best in the industry at returning calls and emails, as well as giving you honest information on the property, its potential and limitations, and pricing commentary.

item.itunes:title: How To Properly Set And Increase Lot Rents
item.title: How To Properly Set And Increase Lot Rents
item.description:
One of the most important aspects to owning a mobile home park is setting the correct lot at purchase, and then again annually in the form of a lot rent increase. It determines how much money you’ll make, how strong you will attract new residents, how well you’ll retain existing tenants, and many other key factors. In fact, it’s probably the single most important part of creating value with any mobile home park. So how can you do it professionally and correctly every time?

In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report, we’re going to examine in-depth this important business practice and unlock the mysteries as to the proper steps to selecting the right lot rent for your property.

item.itunes:title: How To Get More Done On Less Money With Virtual Assistants
item.title: How To Get More Done On Less Money With Virtual Assistants
item.description: One of the biggest aids to increasing your time efficiency are “virtual assistants”. In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report, Brandon is going to review how he finds, manages and saves a ton of money using virtual assistants on a number of tasks. If you have ever thought about delegating various mobile home park acquisition and management roles to the new-age labor pool of these internet-based workers -- at low rates and in the absence of the usual nightmares of U.S. labor law -- then this discussion will get you pointed in the right direction.

item.description: Randy Dailey is our ramrod in the field that gets things done in a big way, tackling tough issues on park turn-arounds and special infrastructure projects. He has agreed to start doing periodic reports with us we’ve titled “From the Trenches” and this first discussion is on the reality of renovating park-owned homes. If you’ve bought a park with park-owned homes – or are looking at buying one – this episode addresses the important steps to bringing old homes back to life the right way.

item.description: Eddie Biller and David Joreteg have purchased several communities since they attended our Mobile Home Park Investor’s Boot Camp a few years ago -- and they’re still buying more. item.itunes:title: Getting To Know Your Residents In A Positive And Productive Manner
item.title: Getting To Know Your Residents In A Positive And Productive Manner
item.description: Sam Walton once said “there is only one boss: the customer. He can fire everybody in the company from the chairman on down.” With so much at stake in ensuring that customers like your mobile home park and don’t want to leave, it’s important to engage them in a positive manner to get continual feedback on how your property is doing without allowing these attempts at positive customer interaction to be derailed. In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report we’re going to discuss the different methods of talking to your customers that have proven to be successful, as well as those that should be avoided.

item.itunes:title: Creative Mobile Home Park Deal Making
item.title: Creative Mobile Home Park Deal Making
item.description: We have long been an advocate of being a “deal maker” instead of a “deal killer” as one makes money and the other misses out on endless opportunities. Although every deal cannot be constructed in a successful manner, many mobile home parks require some creative thought in order to work out. In this teleconference, we’re going to explore the theme of “Creative Deal Making” and discuss the different methods used to bridge the gap between deals that can’t be done and deals that can. If you’re looking at buying a mobile home park, this is a conversation that should be of extreme value.

item.description: Perry Burget is Dave’s brother, as well as the head of our due diligence department. He has performed diligence on over a thousand mobile home parks, with around 400 of those ones that we ultimately purchased. In this MHU Investor’s Club Special Report, we’re going to find out the macro items that typically are representative of parks we buy vs. those we don’t. The goal is to give you an overview of some traits that lead to successful purchases as well as ones that should make you cancel immediately.

item.itunes:title: The Top Five Things To Do Before And After Closing With Kevin Fosshage
item.title: The Top Five Things To Do Before And After Closing With Kevin Fosshage
item.description: So you’re buying a mobile home park and closing day is approaching. What are the key things to prepare for? In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report, we’re going to discuss this issue with Kevin Fosshage, who has served as the “park transition” person in the past (like the Army Ranger that hits the park on the front end) and is now our Regional Vice-President. We’re going to go over not only the steps, but also share stories of the crazy things you have to watch out for in order to have a smooth transition. This discussion should be of interest to anyone looking at buying a park and is packed with lessons learned.

item.itunes:title: My Week with the Irish Documentary Film Producer
item.title: My Week with the Irish Documentary Film Producer
item.description: How does the American mobile home park industry appear to the rest of the world? What can be learned from someone who has been studying the global issue of affordable housing? In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report, we’re going to review the lessons learned from my experiences this week in allowing an Irish film producer to follow along with me while driving our parks in Wisconsin, all part of his documentary film on the affordable housing crisis. I learned a lot, and I think he did as well. Apparently, what we do is much more favorably received in Europe than it is in this country – which is both alarming and disappointing. But maybe the industry can still change that perception going forward. That was the main reason we let him ride around, as I’m hoping he could make a good film that shows our industry in a favorable light.
item.content:encoded: How does the American mobile home park industry appear to the rest of the world? What can be learned from someone who has been studying the global issue of affordable housing? In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report, we’re going to review the lessons learned from my experiences this week in allowing an Irish film producer to follow along with me while driving our parks in Wisconsin, all part of his documentary film on the affordable housing crisis. I learned a lot, and I think he did as well. Apparently, what we do is much more favorably received in Europe than it is in this country – which is both alarming and disappointing. But maybe the industry can still change that perception going forward. That was the main reason we let him ride around, as I’m hoping he could make a good film that shows our industry in a favorable light.
item.itunes:author: Brandon Reynolds

item.itunes:title: Lessons Learned With Frank From California
item.title: Lessons Learned With Frank From California
item.description: Buying a park can be scary. Buying the wrong park can be worse. But as long as you are learning from the experience, it’s not all bad. Particularly when it teaches you exactly what you should buy and you end up with some great parks going forward. Such was the case for MHU Club member Frank from California. In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report, we’re going to have our Lessons Learned episode with Frank and hear the story of how he turned a rocky start in California into a successful adventure in Tennessee and Georgia. You will be amazed at the number of lessons learned in this show.

item.itunes:title: Bank Chat With John Medernach
item.title: Bank Chat With John Medernach
item.description: John Medernach is a well-known banker with First Secure Community Bank – and we’re one of the bank’s customers. John is also an active MHU Investor’s Club member. But what we like best about John is that he really understands mobile home park lending from both sides of the table. That makes him the perfect speaker on our topic of “Being a Good Borrower from a Banker’s Perspective”. We’re going to review what a bank likes to see on 1) park attributes 2) the loan package and 3) the borrower. It’s rare when you can get an honest assessment of banking from someone as experienced as John.

item.itunes:title: Bank Chat With Anthony DiMarco
item.title: Bank Chat With Anthony DiMarco
item.description:
Anthony DiMarco is a well-known loan broker at Security Mortgage Group with over 30 years experience and a regular annual loan volume of over $400 million. He’s seen all types of deals over the past three decades and is well-known to be a master at getting financing on tough transactions. In this “Bank Chat” special Anthony is going to review the following potential financing killers and explain what the minimum requirements would be to get a loan done:

  • High levels of vacancy
  • Bad financial records
  • Financial records that don’t align (tax returns vs. financial statements)
  • Floodplain
  • Private water/sewer
  • Master-metered electric/gas
  • Grandfathering problems
  • Borrower lack of experience
  • Contracts with short time frames for financing
  • States or markets that banks hate right now

Some of his answers may shock you, others may give you hope on deals you’re currently working on. In any event, we think you’ll find this MHU Investor’s Club special extremely informative.

He’ll discuss current interest rates and terms, what states are hot and not, real-life difficult loans and how they got solved, and a host of other issues. We think you’ll enjoy this new addition.

item.itunes:title: E=MHC2 - The Science Of Mobile Home Park Investing
item.title: E=MHC2 - The Science Of Mobile Home Park Investing
item.description: We’re going to go over the math of successful mobile home park deals, as opposed to what doesn’t work. Titled “E=MHC2: The Science of Buying Mobile Home Parks”, we’re going to break down all of the pieces of what a successful investment is comprised of in granular detail. Following the discussion we’re going to have unlimited Q&A so that all questions are answered.

item.itunes:title: Lesson Learned With Justin Donald - June 2019
item.title: Lesson Learned With Justin Donald - June 2019
item.description: Justin Donald has been buying mobile home parks for a decade, having attended the 2009 Boot Camp and quickly jumping into his first deal. Over the past ten years he has leaned a huge amount as he has grown to five communities under ownership. In this edition of “Lessons Learned” we’re going to find out Justin’s observations about what makes a mobile home park successful, as well as what mistakes he corrected. Since nobody knows the mobile home park business better than those who have experienced the methodology and metrics of buying and operating one, “Lessons Learned” is dedicated to the discussion of these important points.

item.itunes:title: Pitches And Hits With Steven Tomaso - May 2019
item.title: Pitches And Hits With Steven Tomaso - May 2019
item.description: In this edition of our popular Pitches and Hits program we’re going to hear from Steven Tomaso, a broker with IRE Investment. He’s been a broker for three years and was formerly the Senior Vice-President of SUN Communities (a REIT and 2nd largest park owner in the U.S.). He focuses on New York and the surrounding area. His deals range in price from around $500,000 to $5 million, and he’s going to go over two of his current listings in Albany, NY and Glen Falls, NY. It’s his first visit to the show, and he has a good handle on what community buyers want from his SUN experience. If you’re looking for a park to buy, Steven is a good resource.

item.itunes:title: A Deal We Bought/A Deal We Dropped - May 2019
item.title: A Deal We Bought/A Deal We Dropped - May 2019
item.description: What makes a deal worth buying and another worth cancelling? That’s the topic of this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report: A Deal We Bought/A Deal We Dropped. We’re going to review a park in Bryan, Texas that we elected to purchase and another in Illinois that didn’t make the cut. We’re going to review the market, the numbers, the risks, the reward, and show you exactly how we made our decision. If you’re looking at buying a mobile home park and wondering what your final decision should be, this show will help you make that final determination.

item.itunes:title: Options To Make Money With Cable
item.title: Options To Make Money With Cable
item.description: Nearly every mobile home park has a hidden asset that rarely gets talked about: the monetization of cable rights. In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report, we’re going to talk about the mechanics of monetizing these rights, as well as additional methods to make cable into a recurring or one-time revenue generator. Since this type of income is considered “real property” by lenders and subject to inclusion in the cap rate valuation, even a small amount of income can pay big dividends when you go to refinance or sell the property.

item.itunes:title: How To Finance Mobile Home Parks Under $500,000 In Price
item.title: How To Finance Mobile Home Parks Under $500,000 In Price
item.description: Buying smaller mobile home parks is often highly lucrative. Some of the best deals – from a cap rate perspective – some from parks under $500,000 in total price. But how do you financing these smaller properties, since most lenders are looking for deals more in the $1 million + range? In this first Lecture Series Event of 2018, Frank Rolfe is going to give an exhaustive review of the different options to finance deals at this price level. He’s going to go over both “inside the box” and “outside the box” approaches, and give real-life examples of each one, based on real deals that he and Dave have made over the years. As the 5th largest mobile home park owner in the U.S – in tandem with his partner Dave Reynolds – there will be over two decades of facts and experience discussed in this event.

item.itunes:title: Ten Things You Need To Know About Filling Lots
item.title: Ten Things You Need To Know About Filling Lots
item.description: So you are looking at buying a park with some vacant lots in it. What are some of the most important things to think about in filling those lots? In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report, we’re going to discuss ten important steps to filling lots – both in preparation as well as home selection and financing. Since you’re going to have vacant lots in virtually every community you buy, these are ten items that you definitely need to know.

item.itunes:title: A Focus On Flooding
item.title: A Focus On Flooding
item.description: With the aftermath of Hurricanes Harvey and Irma, it’s hard not to be concerned about mobile home parks and flooding. In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report, we’re going to talk with Kurt Kelley of Mobile Insurance (who insures several thousand park owners) and get the facts regarding what the issues are concerning mobile home parks and water risks, as well as what you can do to mitigate them. You can’t feel good about owning a mobile home park if you worry constantly about flooding, so we’re going to try to bracket those risks, and see what’s out there to protect against water catastrophes.

item.itunes:title: Pitches & Hits With Kevan Enger - September 2017
item.title: Pitches & Hits With Kevan Enger - September 2017
item.description: Kevin Enger has been a mobile home park broker for over six years, and has a great reputation as someone that is easy to work with. In this week’s MHU Investor’s Club Special Report, Kevin is going to discuss over ten listings that he is currently offering, which range in states from Florida to Nebraska. And, as always, Frank will be there to offer color commentary on the markets. If you are looking for a park to buy, you should consider these listings and adding Kevin to your list of brokers for continual contact.
